alert.note: Alert for Lamar (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 6:14PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lamar County through 700 PM CDT... At 614 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sulligent, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Vernon, Sulligent, Detroit, Beaverton, Blooming Grove, Lamar County Airport, Crews, Bedford, Crossville, Gattman, Cody, Henson Springs, Lamar County Public Lake and Pine Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
